properties.headline: Wind Chill Advisory issued January 15 at 4:24AM CST until January 16 at 3:00PM CST by NWS Bismarck ND
properties.description:
* WHAT...For the Wind Chill Warning, dangerously cold wind
chills. Wind chills as low as 45 below zero. For the Wind
Chill Advisory, very cold wind chills expected. Wind chills as
low as 40 below zero.

* WHERE...Divide, Burke, Williams and Mountrail counties.

* WHEN...For the Wind Chill Warning, until 6 PM CST this
evening. For the Wind Chill Advisory, from 6 PM this evening
to 3 PM CST Thursday.

* IMPACTS...The dangerously cold wind chills could cause
frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 10 minutes.
properties.instruction:
A Wind Chill Warning means the combination of very cold air and
strong winds will create dangerously low wind chill values. This
will result in frost bite and lead to hypothermia or death if
precautions are not taken.

A Wind Chill Advisory means that very cold air and strong winds
will combine to generate low wind chills. This will result in
frost bite and lead to hypothermia if precautions are not taken.

NWSheadline: WIND CHILL WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM CST THIS EVENING... ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 6 PM CST THIS EVENING UNTIL 3 PM CST THURSDAY
